required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sonendo GentleWave™ System for Treatment in Molar Teeth Requiring Root Canal Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter Study Comparing Healing After Treatment With the Sonendo GentleWave™ System as Compared to a Traditional Root Canal Therapy Literature Control

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, literature controlled, clinical study evaluating healing rates for the Sonendo GentleWave System in the treatment of 1st and 2nd molars indicated for root canal therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Subject teeth that are healed or healing at the 12 month follow-up visit.
primary_outcome.description: Healed is defined by absence of a radiographic indication of apical periodontitis (PAI <3) and absence of clinical signs and symptoms other than tenderness to percussion. Healing is defined by a reduction of radiolucency (if radiolucency is present at Baseline) combined with the absence of clinical signs and symptoms other than tenderness to percussion.

arm_group.description: The Sonendo GentleWave System is intended to prepare, clean, and irrigate 1st and 2nd molar teeth indicated for root canal therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 75 years of age
- Indicated for root canal therapy
- First or second molar
- Signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor oral hygiene
- Class II or III mobility
- Open or incompletely formed root apices
- Vertical fracture, horizontal fracture, or perforation below the Cemento-Enamel Junction (CEJ)
- Previous pulpectomy or root canal therapy
Note: Additional exclusion criteria may apply.
